subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] alphabet project
msgSnippet: Paul: I would second Moira on the impact of your letters.  I was quite taken by them.  I went to bed after seeing them and couldn t get those crimson ribbons
messageBody:
Paul:

I would second Moira on the impact of your letters.  I was quite taken by them.  I went to bed after seeing them and couldn't get those crimson ribbons out of my mind.  I wonder if they will appear as elegant and work as well at normal font sizes?

Paige

Moira O'Brien wrote:
Hello Paul
 
Your script is really beautiful with the calligraphy pen.  However, there is one mistake that I can see - the letter KICK is on the wrong line, it is showing as a descender.
 
As an aside - why do you spell  ThoT with an  h ?  That would suggest to me that the pronunciation of that word was th-hoth.  Just curiosity :).
 
-mQra
Moira


 
On 11/10/2007, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@iglou. com> wrote:

I am creating a high quality images of the letters of Quikscript. I will
post these images when I am done. I want these images to serve as model
letters to help newcomers such as myself. I know when I do calligraphy
it helps not only to have a picture of each letter, but to have a huge
picture of one.

I have included the first 7 letters of the alphabet in hopes that I can
get some feedback. The letters in red are the ones that are done. (This
will be completely clear when you open the files.)

I wanted to vary the line weight of my letters, so used the calligraphy
tool in my drawing program. I'm afraid the letters are a little too
angular. I want to create a plain, standard alphabet, not a fancy one.

Thanks for all your feedback so far,

Paul
